{{also|Schon|schön}} ==German== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|gmh|schōne|t=beautifully; appropriately; completely}}, from {{inh|de|goh|scōno|t=beautifully}}, adverb of {{m|goh|scōni}}, whence {{cog|de|schön|t=beautiful}}. [[w:Friedrich Kluge|Kluge, Friedrich]] (1975). ''Etymologisches Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache''. 21st edition. Berlin: Walter de Gruyter. p. 675. ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|/ʃoːn/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ʃɔn/}} {{a|alternatively in central and southern Germany}} * {{audio|de|De-at-schon.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|oːn|ɔn}} ====Adverb==== {{de-adv}} # [[already]] {{gloss|happening rather early, continuing rather long}} #: {{ux|de|Es ist erst 11 Uhr und '''schon''' über 30 Grad im Schatten.|t=It’s only 11 a.m. and '''already''' more than 30 degrees ([[Celsius|C°]]) in the shade.}} #: {{ux|de|Er ist '''schon''' seit drei Wochen krank.|t=He’s been sick for three weeks '''already.'''}} # [[previously]], [[before]] {{gloss|at some time in the past; ''but not'': before a certain event}} #: {{ux|de|Ich erinnere mich, dass wir solche Fälle '''schon''' hatten.|t=I remember that we had such cases '''before.'''}} # {{non-gloss definition|expresses that an action has been completed}}; [[already]] {{i|but more frequent}}; [[yet]] {{i|in questions}} #: {{ux|de|Wir sind spät dran, aber diesen Stapel haben wir immerhin '''schon''' bearbeitet.|t=We’re running late, but at least we’ve ('''already''') finished this pile.}} #: {{ux|de|Hast du dir '''schon''' die Zähne geputzt?|t=Have you brushed your teeth '''yet?'''}} # {{lb|de|modal particle}} {{non-gloss definition|expresses a weighing of arguments, contrast between two statements, partial agreement, concession}}; [[admittedly]]; [[sure|sure(ly)]]; [[definitely]]; [[indeed]] #: {{ux|de|Man sollte Kinder nicht bestrafen. — Man sollte Kinder '''schon''' bestrafen, nur eben sinnvoll.|t=One shouldn’t punish children. — One should '''definitely''' punish children, but wisely.}} #: {{ux|de|Niedrige Steuern heben den Konsum. — Das ist '''schon''' richtig, aber...|t=Low taxes increase consumption. — That is '''admittedly''' true, but...}} #: {{ux|de|Du merkst doch auch, dass ich Recht habe? — Ja, '''schon.'''|t=You do see I’m right, don’t you? — Yeah, '''I guess'''.}} =====Usage notes===== * In order to emphasize ''schon'' in the sense of “already”, another fitting adverb of time is usually added: “Are you done already?” → ''Bist du {{m|de|jetzt}} schon fertig?'' Stressing ''schon'' itself is also possible but less common. In some other senses, however, ''schon'' is commonly stressed. =====Synonyms===== * {{sense|already|yet}} {{l|de|bereits}} * {{sense|admittedly|surely}} {{l|de|doch}}, {{l|de|ja}}, {{l|de|jawohl}}, {{l|de|wirklich}} ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|already}} {{l|de|erst}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|schon mal}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|/ʃoːn/}} * {{rhymes|de|oːn}} ====Verb==== {{head|de|verb form}} # {{de-verb form of|schonen|i|s}} # {{lb|de|colloquial}} {{de-verb form of|schonen|1|s|g}} ===References=== [[Category:German modal particles]]
